Here’s what I found regarding Standard Chartered’s performance and workforce as of the first half of 2025:

H1 2025 Revenue & Key Financial Highlights

  • Operating income (i.e., revenue): USD 10.9 billion in H1 2025, a 10 % YoY increase on a constant currency basis (sc.com).
  • Pretax profit: Approximately USD 4.38 billion, marking a 26 % increase compared to analysts’ expectations (reuters.com, fitchratings.com).

So in simpler terms, Standard Chartered’s “revenue” in the first six months of 2025 was USD 10.9 billion.

Workforce — Number of Employees (Contractors Not Specified)

  • As of 2025, Standard Chartered reports having 83,000 employees worldwide (en.wikipedia.org).
  • Their careers page likewise confirms: “Our 83,000 employees work across 52 markets” (sc.com).
  • Historical data from Macrotrends shows employee figures for 2024 at 81,145, and 2023 at 85,007 — again, this is for employees, not including contractors (macrotrends.net).

Unfortunately, there is no clear public breakdown available for contractors or contingent workers during H1 2025, so I can’t provide a number on that front.

Summary (No Tables – as requested)

  • First-half 2025 Revenue (Operating Income): USD 10.9 billion (up 10 % YoY at constant currency)
  • Pre-tax Profit (H1 2025): USD 4.38 billion (approximate, 26 % above estimates)
  • Global Employees: About 83,000 (contractors not specified)

If you’re looking for insight into contractors or contract staffing details, those figures are typically disclosed in more granular internal reporting or specific sustainability/annual reports and might require direct access to investor relations or human resources disclosures.
